Þat
b&rrot;ou&yogh;te brou&yogh;te
þo Enguelond &punctelev; al to grounde iwis
Fo&rrot; þe engli&slong;che barones bicomen &slong;ome &punctelev; on treo and fal&slong;e al&slong;o
To bitrai&yogh;e heom &slong;eolf and heo&rrot;e k&ydot;ng &punctelev; þat so muche heom truste to
¶Þis No&rrot;emauns and þis Engli&slong;che men &punctelev; ane dai of bataile hu&ydot; nome
Þare a&slong;e þe Abbeie of þe bataille is &punctelev; ate da&ydot;e to gadere hu&ydot; come
To grounde hu&ydot; &slong;miten and &slong;lowen al&slong;o &punctelev; ake ala&slong; þulke &slong;tounde
Þat Enguelond wa&slong; þo&rrot;u&yogh; tre&slong;oun &punctelev; þare ib&rrot;ou&yogh;t to grounde
F or þulke þat þe king tru&slong;te to &punctelev; failleden him wel fa&slong;te
So þat he was bineoþe i&rrot;ou&yogh;t &punctelev; and ouercome at þe la&slong;te
And to grounde ib&rrot;ou&yogh;t and alle his &punctelev; and al Engueldond al&slong;o
Into vnecouþe manne&slong; honde &punctelev; þat no ri&yogh;ht ne hadden þar to
And neuer e&slong;t ne cam a&yogh;ein &punctelev; to ri&yogh;hte E&ydot;re&slong; none
¶Vnku&ydot;nde E&ydot;&rrot;e&slong; &yogh;eot hu&ydot; beothþ &punctelev; o&rrot;e kingues echone
And nei&yogh;h &yogh;wat alle þis hei&yogh;e Men &punctelev; and of þe lo&yogh;we Al&slong;o
Fo&rrot; willam liet crouni king &punctelev; þo þe bataile was al ido
And bisette al enguelond &punctelev; with men of oþere londe
Neuere&slong;t to is cu&ydot;nde heritage &punctelev; ne cam it ich onder&slong;tonde
¶Þis william bas&slong;tard þat wa&slong; king &punctelev; &slong;ethþe him onder&slong;tod
Þat he mid vnri&yogh;hte hadde i&slong;ched &punctelev; mani ane mannes blod
And þare a&slong; þe bataille wa&slong; &punctelev; ane Abbei&yogh;e he het arere
Þat þe Abbeie of þe bataille is icleoped &punctelev; þat wel noble &slong;tand &yogh;eot þere
For heo&rrot;e &slong;oulene he a&slong; het arere &punctelev; þat he with vnri&yogh;hte þare Aslou&yogh;
Ake euere he heold fo&rrot;th þe k&ydot;nedom &punctelev; of enguelonde with wou&yogh;
¶Ake &slong;one &slong;o he wa&slong; king imad &punctelev; and al enguelond bisette
A&slong;e he wolde with &slong;traunge men &punctelev; and no man ne mi&yogh;hte him lette
Þis holie Bi&slong;chop seint wol&slong;ton &punctelev; wel ofte him with &slong;eide
Þat he with on ri&yogh;hte hadde ido &punctelev; a &slong;wuch luþer dede
And &slong;pat a&yogh;ein him baldeliche &punctelev; and ne &slong;parede fo&rrot; no d&rrot;ede
For he wa&slong; þo þe cu&ydot;nde&slong;te engli&slong;che man &punctelev; þat wa&slong; of enie manhede
And fo&rrot; alle oþure weren de&slong;eritede nei&ydot;h &punctelev; þe king wa&slong; with heom wrothþ
Þat he wa&slong; &slong;o lu&ydot;te a d&rrot;ad of him &punctelev; and &slong;wo&rrot; Anon is othþ
To pulte him out of is bi&slong;chop&rrot;op&rrot;iche &punctelev; he liet &slong;omune al&slong;o
To we&slong;tmini&slong;tre to an&slong;werien him &punctelev; of þat he him hadde mi&slong;do
¶Nou nas nou&yogh;t &slong;eint wul&slong;ton &punctelev; wel gret clerk in lo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; þo he &slong;cholde to &slong;cole gon &punctelev; to churche he &yogh;eode wel mo&rrot;e
To we&slong;tmini&slong;tre he cam to is da&ydot; &punctelev; a&slong;e he wa&slong; i&slong;omoned er
Þe king wa&slong; in grete wrathþe &punctelev; wel p&rrot;e&slong;t to kepe him þer
And þe bi&slong;chop of Cannterburi &punctelev; lanfranc &punctelev; wa&slong; is name
And þe bi&slong;chop Gondolf of Rouce&slong;tre &punctelev; alle to don him &slong;chame
Seint wol&slong;ton bi heom cam &punctelev; þat a&yogh;ein him weren &slong;o &slong;trongue
A&slong;e þeof bifo&rrot;e Ju&slong;ti&slong;e &punctelev; his dom to vnderfongue
¶Þe king and þe Erchebi&slong;chop al&slong;o &punctelev; &slong;peken to him wo&rrot;de&slong; grete
Þat he &slong;cholde a&slong;e he wu&ydot;&rrot;þe wa&slong; &punctelev; i&slong; bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche lete
Forto holden &slong;wuch dignete &punctelev; to lu&ydot;te he couþe of lo&rrot;e
And hu&ydot; him hadden to longue iþoled &punctelev; and þo nolden hu&ydot; nonmo&rrot;e
And grete fole&slong; hu&ydot; weren þat &slong;wuch afol &punctelev; fo&rrot;me&slong;t b&rrot;ou&yogh;te in &slong;wch mi&yogh;hte
And &yogh;if he wa&slong; folliche onderfongue &punctelev; hu&ydot; wolden don him out with ri&yogh;hte
¶Seint wol&slong;ton &slong;tod wel mildeliche &punctelev; and herknede al þat hu&ydot; &slong;ede
Nadde he noman bote god &punctelev; to his an&slong;were him rede
Sire&slong; he &slong;eide ri&yogh;ht it is &punctelev; þat ich eoure he&slong;te do
For &slong;ire king þou art an &slong;ouerein &punctelev; and þe erchebi&slong;chop al&slong;o
Þe croce ich habbe &yogh;are ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; þat &yogh;e i&slong;eothþ here lo
Aknowe ich am wel ich wor &punctelev; þat inam nou&yogh;t wu&ydot;&rrot;þe þer to
&YOGH;wane &yogh;e wollez þat ich a&slong; bileue &punctelev; a&slong;e man þat vnwurþ is
Wel fam ichulle eonwer he&slong;te do &punctelev; a&slong;e mine &slong;ouereine&slong; iwis
Vnbou&yogh;h&slong;ome to holie churche &punctelev; iwis inelle be nou&yogh;t
To &yogh;elden hire up a&slong;e &yogh;e me hotez &punctelev; ich habbe a&slong;e ib&rrot;ou&yogh;t
¶Ake for &yogh;e ne token a&slong; me nou&yogh;t &punctelev; I nelle eou take non
Ake him þat a&slong; me bitok &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e eov euerechon
Þe guode Man þat a&slong; me bitok &punctelev; &yogh;eonde he lijchþ wel &slong;tille
Ich a&slong; wulle him taken up &punctelev; and þanne ich do eoure wille
¶To seint Edwarde&slong; toumbe he wende &punctelev; þat wa&slong; of Marb&rrot;e &slong;ton
A nam up is croiz wel mildeliche &punctelev; and &slong;mot þe point þaron
Þe &slong;taf wende into þe marb&rrot;e&slong;ton &punctelev; a&slong;e it were in ne&slong;che &slong;onde
Nou he seide ich him habbe bitake &punctelev; þat a&slong;tok me
And bifo&rrot;e eov here &punctelev; i&yogh;ollden op dignete
Takez a&slong; nouþe &yogh;wam &yogh;e wollez &punctelev; &slong;om þat bet beo in lo&rrot;e
And habbez guod dai nouþe euerethone &punctelev; &yogh;e ne mouwen e&slong;che men non mo&rrot;e
¶Þi&slong; holie Man wende fo&rrot;th &punctelev; amon heom alle wel &slong;ofte
Þat folk &slong;tod a&slong;e it were inome &punctelev; and biheolden þe croce wel ofte
Hou heo &slong;tod in þe Marb&rrot;e &slong;ton &punctelev; &slong;o deope and &slong;o fa&slong;te
Of þe Miracle heom wond&rrot;ede alle &punctelev; and &slong;ome Weren &slong;o&rrot;e agaste
Some wenden þar to &slong;one &punctelev; þe croce up fo&rrot;to d&rrot;awe
Þare na&slong; no &slong;o &slong;trong of heom &punctelev; þat mi&yogh;hte hire ene&slong; wawe
Hu&ydot; po&rrot;ueiden er &slong;ire Gondolf &punctelev; bi&slong;chop of rouce&slong;tre
Þat he &slong;cholde aftur &slong;eint wol&slong;ton &punctelev; beon Bi&slong;chop of wirece&slong;tre
¶Þe Erchebi&slong;chop aros him up &punctelev; to &slong;ai&slong;i þe croiz anon
Þe Bi&slong;chop of Rouce&slong;tre wel baldeliche &punctelev; þudereward gan gon
Þ croiz he nam and fa&slong;te he d&rrot;ou&yogh; &punctelev; in þe Marb&rrot;e &slong;ton
He no mi&yogh;hte hire nou&yogh;t ene&slong; wawien &punctelev; þat folk wond&rrot;ede echon
And þare aboute wel þicke ornen &punctelev; þat wonder fo&rrot;to &slong;eo
Þo þe king and þe Erchebi&slong;chop i&slong;ei&yogh;en &punctelev; þat non oþur it ne mi&yogh;hte beo
Heom of þou&yogh;te heo&rrot;e dede &punctelev; after seint wol&slong;ton &slong;ende
And þat hu&ydot; wolden in faire manere &punctelev; heo&rrot;e tre&slong;pa&slong;a mede
¶Þe Messagers iredie weren &punctelev; and aftur him &slong;one wenden
&YOGH;eot þis holie Man for al þe gult &punctelev; i&slong; heo&rrot;te to heom bende
And &slong;eide ich mot nede it do &punctelev; mine souereines wille
To court he wende a&yogh;ein to heom &punctelev; wel mildeliche and &slong;tille
Þo he wa&slong; to court icome &punctelev; hu&ydot; arisen a&yogh;ein him þere
Þe king and þe Erchebi&slong;chop al&slong;o &punctelev; and oþere þat þare were
With gret honur hu&ydot; cleopeden him fo&rrot;thþ &punctelev; fo&rrot;&yogh;iuene&slong;&slong; him bede
And boden amendi a&yogh;ein him &punctelev; al heo&rrot;e grete mi&slong;dede
And beden him mine a&yogh;ein is croce &punctelev; and con bi heo&rrot;e rede
Fo&rrot; he wa&slong; bet wu&ydot;&rrot;þe þare to &punctelev; þane am oþur hu&ydot; &slong;eide
¶Nai certe&slong; &slong;ire&slong; quath Seint Wol&slong;ton &punctelev; þat nere me nou&yogh;t to do wu&ydot;&rrot;þe þare to
Ake nimeth &yogh;wam eower wille be &punctelev; an oþur þat conne mo&rrot;e
Þe k&ydot;ng and þe Erchebi&slong;chop al&slong;o &punctelev; beden him milce and o&rrot;e
And &slong;eiden þat þere na&slong; non oþur &punctelev; þat &slong;o wu&ydot;&rrot;þe were þare to
Longue it wa&slong; are þis holie man &punctelev; wolde heo&rrot;e wille do
Ake fo&rrot;to obeien is souerein&slong; &punctelev; he wende fo&rrot;th atþe la&slong;te
And nam þe croce wel mildeliche &punctelev; þare he &slong;tikede here er &slong;o fa&slong;te
¶Also li&yogh;htliche a&slong;e ani þing &punctelev; þe croce he gan up d&rrot;awe
Þat so mani men fondeden er &punctelev; and ne mi&yogh;hten hire ene&slong; wawe
Þicke o&rrot;n þat folk abouten him &punctelev; and no wonder it na&slong;
Þe miracle wa&slong; &slong;one wide ikud &punctelev; þat &slong;o apert wa&slong;
Men anoureden þis holie Man &punctelev; al&slong;o muche a&slong;e hu&ydot; mi&yogh;hte
His power þat him wa&slong; er binome &punctelev; he tok a&yogh;ein with ri&yogh;hte
A&yogh;ein to i&slong; bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche &punctelev; with gret honour he him d&rrot;ou&yogh;
His Couent vnderfeng him faire &punctelev; with grete noblei&yogh;e inou&yogh;
¶Þis holie Man ladde al is lif &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe faire and clene
Sijkne&slong;&slong;es þare weren wel fewe &punctelev; þat man wolde him offe mene
Þat he ne b&rrot;ou&yogh;te to hele a non &punctelev; þo&rrot;u&yogh; o&rrot;e louerde&slong; grace
Sike men wek þicke comen &punctelev; to him in eche place
Deue and doumbe and blinde al&slong;o &punctelev; he helde þo&rrot;u&yogh; gode&slong; grace
&YOGH;wane hu&ydot; comen to him &punctelev; ou&yogh;were in am place
So longue he leouede on eo&rrot;þe here &punctelev; þat he wa&slong; of grete elde
His bodi bigan to heneg&ydot; &slong;wiþe &punctelev; grete feble&slong;&slong;e he fielde
¶A slou&yogh; feuere him cam on &punctelev; þat ne nam him nou&yogh;t ful &slong;trongue
Acheo made i&slong; bodi to melte awei &punctelev; þat la&slong;te &slong;wiþe longue
Seue ni&yogh;ht bifo&rrot;e þat he deide &punctelev; his b&rrot;eþren he liet fette alle
And liet him alle is ri&yogh;hte&slong; &punctelev; and &slong;eide &yogh;wat heom &slong;cholde bifalle
Out of þis wo&rrot;ld to heouene he wende &punctelev; þare &slong;chal a&ydot; bileue
In þe Monþe of Jeneuer &punctelev; a &slong;eint fabinane&slong; eue
¶A þou&slong;end &yogh;er and nie hund&rrot;et &punctelev; and foure þare bifo&rrot;e
It wa&slong; þat o&rrot;e &slong;wete louerd &punctelev; on o&rrot;þe wa&slong; ibo&rrot;e
In þe teoþe &yogh;ere al&slong;o &punctelev; of þe kinedom ? Of willam þe rede king &punctelev; þat aftur willa bastard cam ?
And four Monþes and four dawe&slong; &punctelev; ibeo in wo&rrot;lde her
Four &slong;co&rrot;e &yogh;er he wa&slong; old &punctelev; and &slong;euene al&slong;o nei&yogh;h
Are he wende out of þis lijf &punctelev; to þe Jo&ydot;e of heuene an hei&yogh;
Þo þis holie man wa&slong; ded &punctelev; þe Monek&slong; comen &slong;one
In þe p&rrot;io&rrot;ie of wirece&slong;tre &punctelev; and duden þat wa&slong; to done
Wu&slong;chen þat bodi a&slong;e it wa&slong; ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; and to churche it bere
Þe Moneke&slong; alle with gret honour &punctelev; þat is b&rrot;eþerne were
Þe &slong;erui&slong;e abouten him hu&ydot; duden &punctelev; a&slong;e it wa&slong; wel ri&yogh;ht
And to &slong;eggen heo&rrot;e &slong;autere&slong; al&slong;o &punctelev; þare bi hu&ydot; woken ani&yogh;ht
¶Þo it was wel with inne ni&yogh;ht &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; &slong;eiden in heo&rrot;e boke
Heom lu&slong;te slepe swiþe wel &punctelev; þat vnneþe&slong; hu&ydot; mi&yogh;hten loke
And &slong;ome ne mi&yogh;hten nou&yogh;t furbere &punctelev; ake lei&yogh;en and slepen fa&slong;te
Some a&slong;e it were in dweolkningue &punctelev; heo&rrot;e ei&yogh;ene to gadere hu&ydot; ca&slong;te
Þat holie bodi þat lai þare ded &punctelev; among heom in þe bere
Aros up wel mildeliche &punctelev; a&slong;e þei it alive were
And a wei&yogh;hte heom euer ech on &punctelev; and bigan atþon ende
And all along þe rewe &punctelev; þo&rrot;u&yogh; þe queo&rrot; he gan iwiende
And euere a&slong;e he awei&yogh;hte heom &punctelev; &slong;umdel gan heom chide
Þat hu&ydot; nolden with heo&rrot;e slep &punctelev; heo&rrot;e ri&yogh;hte t&ydot;me abide
¶So muche is holi heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e fo&rrot; to wite
Þat he nolde þei he were ded &punctelev; his b&rrot;eþerne fur&yogh;ite
Þis Miracle wa&slong; &slong;one ikud &punctelev; a&slong;e ri&yogh;ht wa&slong; þat it were
At wirece&slong;tre he wa&slong; ibured &punctelev; and &yogh;u&ydot; he liht þere
Þare Man ma&ydot; fo&rrot; is holie bodi &punctelev; mani fair Miracle i&slong;eo
Nou god graunt þat we mote with him &punctelev; in þe Jo&ydot;e of heouene beo
